messages.title: A Green New Deal
messages.content: The global economy is in a state. We need to implement a Green New Deal to tackle the environmental and ecological emergencies we face and to create good quality and secure jobs that will help make this transition.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for the global Green New Deal and greater investment in renewable energy, environmentally friendly transport and the protection of woodland and green spaces.
Support for a People’s Vote on a deal with the EU and protecting environmental standards, labour rights, and social welfare measures.
Focus on truly affordable and social housing with an emphasis on protecting the rights of tenants and transparency in new developments.
Support for increased use of electric buses, the reduction of toxic emissions, and enhancements in charging infrastructure.

issues.brexitEurope: Support for a People’s Vote on a deal with the EU.
issues.environment: Promotion of renewable energy, reduction of single-use plastics, protection of woodlands and green spaces.
issues.transport: Support for increased use of electric buses, the reduction of toxic emissions, and enhancements in charging infrastructure.

community.content: Truly affordable and social housing is high on my list of priorities as well as a focus on existing properties lying empty.

leaflet.personalStatement: Janet is a professor of international economic development law and long-standing environmental advocate who has been a Maldon District resident for over 10 years.

quotes.text: I'm acutely aware of the seriousness of the climate emergency and the detrimental effects of our current economic system. I believe we should be custodians of the planet, not plunderers of nature.

examples: I'm acutely aware of the seriousness of the climate emergency and the detrimental effects of our current economic system.
Truly affordable and social housing is high on my list of priorities as well as a focus on existing properties lying empty.
Support for a People’s Vote on a deal with the EU.

personalStories.story: Janet is a professor of international economic development law and has been a Maldon District resident for over 10 years.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Maldon District resident for over 10 years.
nonPolicyAttributes.employment: Professor of international economic development law.
